caption: Cozy and tasty

Let's start saying that I am an italian from the south and I know my food. I have been living in Nyc for several years and this is the only italian restaurant that transports me home. I tried almost everything in the menu (specials included) and everytime I find all the food OUTSTANDING. The quality of the ingredients is superb and the preparation of the dishes is better than so many downtown restaurants. You want a spectacular meal, this is the place.  The staff is polite, attentive and doesn't rash you out! In the pics arancine, eggplant parm, octopus, and chocolate cake.
I really enjoyed eating there. The Chicken Scarpriello was great.
The customer service is constantly fast, great vibes, very kind staff members. Will visit here again when I arrive in town.
Nice area. Food is decent, for Italian. Service needs a little refresher...
Place was delicious everything.... the lasagna was priceless!
Excellent ,Anthony from New York
Delicious food and great service

Food was really good! Had a salad and artichoke appetizer for lunch.  Was plenty.  My friend had ceasar salad and eggplant parmesan appetizer.  She didnt like the salad, but loved the eggplant.   Would definitely return.
Stole money from my pure 50$. Disgusting food and horible waiters rude as he’ll do not go there they will rob you and be rude!
Love their food! Penna vodka and the veal were some of the best I’ve had!
The best service
As awesome as it's big brother Robertos.

My friend took me to this place for my birthday. I live in the neighborhood but hadn't had a chance to try it.  Sorry I waited so long. The menu is not large but the food was amazing. Very well seasoned and authentic.  The service was fantastic as well. Very attentive. Didn't care for the garlic bread. It was overly toasted, so it was a little hard. Everything else, including the sangria was excellent.  I will be back for sure.  It is also beautifully decorated and a nice cozy vibe to enjoy your food.

Nice restaurant, great service. We ordered fried calamari, arancini, capresa salad and linguini Nero.  The fried calamari were outstanding, perfectly cooked, very fresh. The arancini also were good. The linguini were okay, nothing spectacular. I will return to try another plates.
Food and service is good.
Was there for a birthday celebration I bought my own cake  they charge me  per person  For  them cutting it
Wonderful modern Italian food. I had a zuppa di pesce that was too big to finish and delicious. The pasta was terrific.

The food was imaginative and well prepared.  We were "honored guests" at their family table. We came with 2 energetic tots that could have tested the patience of some but they offered special seating and let us attend to them. Other guests were friendly. We were given the largest table that was a little off from other tables so we had a feeling of privacy. Our family dined at ease, unrushed. The place is clean white tile, red checked gingham table cloths,  intimate decor, soft lighting.
Pasta was soooo good friendly service
The food is great
Amazing spot! Everything is delicious and the service is great. We have also never had to wait long for a table. Highly recommend!
Great food but service was kind of slow. Worth going and I would go back.

A cullinan in the rough. Hands-down one of the best Italian restaurants in the Bronx. Excellent service, accessible waitstaff with fresh farm-to-fork ingredients. You must drop by and try their linguine w/ clams and lasagna. The ambiance is warm and cozy ... far from pretentious. A romantic spot with a very affordable wine list.
Yummy
Fantastic Lasagna, great atmosphere, and very little wait.
Delicious food.. great atmosphere
A notch above the others on Arthur Avenue...
Food and service is great
Love Fiasco, the staff is always awesome as well. Their specials are always enticing. I'm still thinking of the veal. Will return very soon!
Really nice staff and lovely food.
White pizza! So good!

The chef is a genius at pairing flavors, all dishes we had were well balanced and delicious. The ambiance is cozy and pleasant, the decor a good blend between traditional Italian and modern. The staff was attentive and nice. I will go back for sure.
The food is fantastic and the service is right on point with class but in a casual setting.  Love it here!!
Although the food was good we waited one hour for our food.

I ordered dinner for my family to be delivered. The restaurant failed to provide all of the food ordered and did not provide and flatware to eat with. When I called them back they advised that it was too close to closing for them to prepare the food we had been shorted and they would refund the $$$ for what had not been delivered. The food that was delivered was not even anywhere near worth the $$$ spent. I would definitely NOT recommend this place to anyone ever. I have been in the restaurant business for 25+ years & traveled the USA. This was by far the worst restaurant experience I have had in several years and most definitely the worst in NYC. Don't waste your $$$ or time on this place. The food was barely edible and the lack of professionalism was simply staggering.
One of the best experiences dining out we've ever had. Exceptional food, service, hospitality.
The food is really good, that place is so cute and kids friendly!
The best for lovers of real natural food. Excellent service.  Best caprese salad ever had.
Amazing food go here now!
The best

I don't leave many 5-star reviews. Five stars means excellence and people who just have a good meal are too quick to spout their praises. So, five stars for Fiasco is perfectly appropriate because it was excellent in every way.  My fiancee and her friend and I hit up Arthur Ave just about 10 pm on a Friday night in June... And bistro after bistro was closed or closing. We were wondering what options we might have aside from bar food at Howl at the Moon when we saw the OPEN sign at Fiasco. It wasn't a mistake: they were open till 11.  I could rave about the service and food but suffice to say they were all great, and not just because they were one off the only places open. We really lucked out that many other places were shutting down otherwise we might have missed this experience.  The ambience is relaxing, the decor is just the right atmosphere, and the food... So delicious. If I go back to Little Italy in the Bronx, I'd hit this place again without hesitation and without trying any of the other restaurants. Truly an excellent experience.
This place has the trifecta: great food, excellent service, and charming ambiance. A class above the neighboring competition. By far my favorite Italian restaurant on Arthur Ave!

I would have given it a 3 stars if it wasn't for the the headwaiter whom was very kind and attentive to our needs. Was really friendly and was able to accommodate 14 of us upon arrival, the place was half empty, so that was not an inconvenience. The Shrimp Scampi was really good. The pizza was not what I was expecting, when I read the sign 'brick wood stove,' for some reason I thought of Adrienne's Pizza.  The bad experience came when I started to see auras - which usually are the beginning of a migraine - and I waived at the waiter assigned to our table whom was already taking our orders and when he approached I  asked him "I know you are only half way, but can you please bring me an espresso, because I'm about to get a migraine and if it is triggered it will give me a really bad headache." That's when he told me "You have to wait until I finish taking the orders, we do things ORGANIZED HERE." Had I been there with just my family we would have stood up and left -considering all the option of dinning available in the area - but I decided to brush it off and waived at the headwaiter whom very kindly brought me the espresso. I drank the caffeine shot and 10 minutes later I was feeling better.  Because I don't like to have hard feelings with anyone, especially with people preparing my food and drinks, I told the waiter assigned to our table when he reached me to take my order, "I want to apologized for trying to rush you with the espresso, but if I didn't get it on time, I would have gotten a killer headache" and his respond was "You should walk around with your medicine, so when something like this happens you can just take it" , that's when I realized this guy was either new to the job, or simply didn't like us, so I just smiled and said, "You are right."  The headwaiter came back 30 minutes later and asked me if I was feeling better, I said "Back to normal, thank you"  A note to the waiter serving our table: it doesn't matter if you're serving whites, blacks or browns, at the end of the day, in the inside, we are all GREEN.
Pretty darn good other then they salted the heck out of the calamari
Amazing food and great portion sizes.

Ask about portions of things you order. We got a calamari appetizer, eggplant parm panini & veal parm platter. Waiter didn't mention everything is super sized. The appetizer was enough to feed 4, the panini was the size of the plate & the veal platter was 3 red sauce smothered veal cutlets (nothing else), clearly meant for family style sharing & not a lunch. I got the sense they were more about having you run a big tab than informing. The food was standard, the wine was good but overall didn't feel it was worth the price.
Warm ambiance, attentive, gracious service, freshly prepared food, handsomely presented. A modern, innovative, flavorful twist on traditional favorites.
The four cheese pizza is VERY special!
Good Italian food
Great place with great service!!!
Fantastic pizza and good service.
The absolute best of Arthur Ave.
Good pizza at litlle Italy.
The best
Great service WONDERFULLY DELICIOUS FOOD
Good restaurant...
Super friendly staff , food was delicious .clean place
Delicious pizza and food, great service.. Had one of my best lunches, I don't leave  5 stars easily.
Nice restaurant. Friendly staff. Would definitely be back.
Food was delicious and the pizza was amazing!
Overall, the food was very good although the shrimps were over cooked. Service was attentive and excellent with a nice chocolate dessert. So yes, give it a go, you won't be disappointed.
Great spot for a nice dinner and wine. They only have wine and beer, no hard liquor is served. Food is great.
Great little place. Friendly service large portions and really tasty food!
Nice Italian food
Very nice and friendly place. Had a early dinner with a girlfriend whom we have our Birthday on the same day. The food was so good we hope to go back soon. It's a small place but cute. I loved it🙌
Best pizza ever

Overall, food was fine, place is cozy, service is good. Wouldn't recommend, but wouldn't mind returning in a pinch.  3 stars because the restaurant meets expectations, but did not excel at anything in particular. The Chicken Francese was notably good though not memorable. The service was attentive though not more than expected. If someone said we'll eat here again, I would certainly not say no. But I would try to explore somewhere else first.  Pros: Serves food until 11 where most places shut at 10, so for later food on Arthur, this would be my recommendation.  Cons: 4 TVs right there upon you while dining. Sports are great, but not while enjoying a family meal.
Everything we had was amazing!  The Fettucini Alfredo, Meatballs, octopus - even burger (my son).   The pasta was fresh, service was great!  I highly recommend!
Fresh Mozzarella and amazing Pasta!!!!

Great food, excellent service, and amazing wine. We ate family style starting with baby octopus and a pizza, then got lamb chops, pasta, and a side of broccoli rabe. The servers were great and made the evening feel perfect. I will say I wasn’t blown away but 100% delicious food.
The pizza and the food here is so good!!
Food was excellent and the staff were exceptional. Authentic and cozy Italian experience.
Great food great service. Makes you feel your back in Italy.  Dont miss there thin crust pizza.
Pizza special today was GREAT. IT was with veal
Excellent and creative cuisine. Delicious with exceptional service. My new favorite spot on Arthur Avenue.
Very good food

Fisrt time ordering form this restaurant. Thank god it was take out. Ordered the Ziti with vodka sauce the taste was far from the taste of fresh pasta in an Italian restaurant in little italy.  I truly beleive that attention to details is what separates the passionate chef/cooks from the novice. The bread that was given was not at least warm, the house salad was cut so bad that I had to cut it again to smaller pieces. See pic that I posted.  The cook didn't even peel off the sticker form the tomato. The dressing was 90% reg oil not even olive oil was used 10% vinegar. As the saying says you only get one chance to make a good impression.  Won't be returning again. There are to many other better choices.
Delicious food and wonderful service!
The short rib risotto was really great
Great food and service
Great service and delicious food.
Great pizza

Ive been here twice it has been fantastic both times.  The service is great, food is served in a timely matter.  Nice italian decor, very clean great portions, very filling, everything seems very fresh. Friendly staff, great beer selection very goid wine selection. Overall if you are looking for a great bang for your buck this is the place to go with how big their portions are. I will definitely be coming back.
Don't waste your time in little Italy downtown... go to the Bronx and enjoy the real one
Fantastic restaurant with excellent service! Hands down the best spaghetti and meatballs I have ever had!
Great pizza

So. One hot Summer night, I pulled my Subaru Impreza into the parking spot directly in front of Arthur Ave Fiasco Restaurant. Now, I don’t I don’t know if it’s the fact that I’m 8 months pregnant, the parking spot was on the left side of street, I was late for dinner.. whatever.. I could not seem to get close enough to the curb to satisfy the intense parallel parking rules of NYC. I backed in and out, in and out.. people were obviously looking at me, staring, judging. After 10 grueling minutes perhaps - I was frustrated. So I said to myself  ‘ ya know what - I don’t care. This is fine.’ I got out of the car to inspect my mediocre parking job, and out comes an angel of a waiter from Fiasco’s. He says “ Can I help you park, I don’t want you to get a ticket.” I looked at him surprised. To find this level of kindness on the streets of NYC is like a myth- too good to be true even! To be completely transparent – I most likely owe twice as much on my car loan as the car is worth; so someone stealing the car would probably be more helpful than harmful at this point. I said okay, thinking I have nothing to lose. The man effortlessly adjusted my car with only one or two turns of the wheel. He got out of the car, handed me the keys, and told me he hoped people had helped his wife more when she was pregnant. Anyway, I just wanted to write this review, because although I was not a patron of Fiascos I still received the most heartwarming and wonderful customer service from his restaurant than I have ever experienced anywhere else. Owner of Fiasco – this man deserves a raise. His name started with an A.. I don’t want to guess in case I get it wrong. Moral of the story- I still have faith in humanity. Thanks Arthur Ave Fiasco!
Decent food. The mozzarella is amazing and a must try.
Great new restaurant on Arthur Avenue. Pizzas,and salads are the best.
Omg love this place. Food is so good... My favorite is the Shrimp scampi.
Friendly staff reasonable prices and fantastic CG ood
Fantasic service and food!!!

Came with family after a Yankee game - food and service were both great!
Greatest experience. Never expected the greatest Roberto cooking in this simpler not up to scale restaurant. The fiasco is this it's actually fantastic and doesnt need look like that. So happy I came
Replaced John's, still great pizza.  But the entrees were even great.  Was there with 6 & everyone loved the good
outstanding food
Great pizza and food and service

Good food great service and very reasonable prices. We had the lasagna, caesar salad, clams and prosciutto pizza. All tasted great. Service was helpful and non intrusive. There is no dessert menu because they said the pastry chef makes different, fresh desserts, and they give you what's available verbally. New York cheesecake was tasty, the strawberries and raspberry sauce was just sweet enough. The warm chocolate cake was ok, but the accompanying gelatto was delicious. Tiramisu was the best we had tried before. We got all this for under $100, so were quite happy when the bill came around.
Food and service was excellent!
People who know,  go.  Little Italy in Manhattan is laughable.
Good music ,good environment, food delicious,professional staff,if you love a quiet place x romantic  music come here
Great service and food.
Quick and delicious
Fiasco’s is a fantastic family-style Italian restaurant in the REAL NYC little Italy on Arthur Ave in the Bronx. Order anything on the menu and it’ll be great.

Does the core of the place is wonderful but as it goes to the waiters serving urban class of people you can see the snottiness other than that just two stars on the Decour just don't go in there wearing a fitted or sweats and then you'll be treated differently !!!! the core of the place is wonderful but as it goes to the waiters serving urban class people you can see the snottiness other than that just two stars on the Decour don't go in there wearing a faded or sweats and then you'll be treated different

Relative newcomer to the Arthur Ave scene, sister restaurant to Zero Otto and Roberto's. Seems to have less of a wait than other Italian restaurants on the strip, and still very delicious. Good wine list with a number of cheaper Italian options. Highly recommend!
Very nice pizza.  Amazing but almost nobody was there.  This place will be packed once people notice it.

Excellent pizza alternative if you wanted to go to their sister restaurant Zero across the street on Arthur Ave. I had a butternut squash pizza that was delicious. Place is attractive and the staff very welcoming. We had been to the Bronx Botanical and this was a great finish to the day.
Horrible food and it has been like that multiple times
Great place. Food was delicious. I ask them to chance the spicy tomatote sauce to regular sause in the Linguine shrimp plate and they did it. I will definitely go back.
another Gem
Really good American-Italian food! Had chicken parm and it was awesome! Huge portions good food, good service. Sister restaurant to Trattoria Zero Otto Nova

We tried Fiasco because its brother restaurant, Roberto's, had too long a wait. We are tough customers, and we were not disappointed. In fact, we were thrilled!  The ambience is quaint, cheerful and bright, the service was excellent and the food was delicious!  The Sole Francese was wonderful, and the Fish Marechiara was light, flavorful and will live in my head until I come back again. And the chocolate cake so transcended your common concept of chocolate cake, that words fall me. And the prices are extremely reasonable. Don't deny yourself this wonderful experience! This is now our first choice.
